1.text: For this cause, I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ, for you Gentiles;

2.text: If yet you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me towards you:

3.text: How that, according to revelation, the mystery has been made known to me, as I have written above in a few words;

4.text: As you reading, may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ,

5.text: Which in other generations was not known to the sons of men, as it is now revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit:

6.text: That the Gentiles should be fellow heirs, and of the same body, and co-partners of his promise in Christ Jesus, by the gospel:

7.text: Of which I am made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God, which is given to me according to the operation of his power:

8.text: To me, the least of all the saints, is given this grace, to preach among the Gentiles, the unsearchable riches of Christ,

9.text: And to enlighten all men, that they may see what is the dispensation of the mystery which hath been hidden from eternity in God, who created all things:

10.text: That the manifold wisdom of God may be made known to the principalities and powers in heavenly places through the church,

11.text: According to the eternal purpose, which he made, in Christ Jesus our Lord:

12.text: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.

13.text: Wherefore I pray you not to faint at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.

14.text: For this cause I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

15.text: Of whom all paternity in heaven and earth is named,

16.text: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened by his Spirit with might unto the inward man,

17.text: That Christ may dwell by faith in your hearts; that being rooted and founded in charity,

18.text: You may be able to comprehend, with all the saints, what is the breadth, and length, and height, and depth:

19.text: To know also the charity of Christ, which surpasseth all knowledge, that you may be filled unto all the fulness of God.

20.text: Now to him who is able to do all things more abundantly than we desire or understand, according to the power that worketh in us;

21.text: To him be glory in the church, and in Christ Jesus unto all generations, world without end. Amen.
